ygData.subject: Re: A Few Questions for Fellow Bards....
ygData.msgSnippet: Anecdotal evidence suggests about a 10% increase in mana restores.  A few messages went by about this in the past couple weeks. If there is no need to heal or
ygData.messageBody:
Anecdotal evidence suggests about a 10% increase in mana restores. A few
messages went by about this in the past couple weeks. If there is no need to
heal or you don't have group heal yet, play the jig while your party waits
on mana restores. Better than playing "Free Bird" for the umpteenth time
<g>

Sylly
Bard of the 8th level
Hog Callers Inn
Freeport, Innoruuk


-----Original Message-----
From: Tim and Mary Steed [mailto:timandmary@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 17, 1999 2:06 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] A Few Questions for Fellow
Bards....

Now, on to another question:
I had a Paladin last night tell me after a battle to play
the Jig O Vigor. I
wasn't sure why, since Stamina replenishes a heck of a lot
faster than HP.
And you know what he told me? The Jig O Vigor actually HELPS
INCREASE THE
RATE OF MANA RESTORATION! I thought at first that this was
bull, and over a
few hours tried to test it with some mages. They all agreed
that it did,
indeed, help (however slightly) them restore mana! Has
anyone else tried
this? Does everyone else KNOW about this already and I am
just now leaving
the stoneage? Any input??
